value.0: "I did not expect to have my loyalties torn so. You are a good person, I am sure, but Enivid is my leader." Dylan frowns uncomfortably.
"There is one last thing I can do for you. Mr. Mossy owns the Mossy Tree Inn. Since you have been such a help, just ask him for the hero's rate and I'm sure he can give you a deal."

Comment.value: if Feran is still head of Military guild / pre-election

value.0: "I just do not feel comfortable speaking to someone who is Enivid's opponent. A part of me even regrets having listened to Momma Dane and opened the gates to you in the first place. I am sorry, goodbye."
"We heard some awful sounds coming from down there. We thought they were the sounds of your death. I am glad you survived. Were you able to put an end to them?"
"He's dead? You... you were able to accomplish this deed against such great odds?"
"This <man/woman> is a hero! We were surely defeated; how could you have overcome the monsters?"
"Perhaps Momma Dane was right. Perhaps you really were sent by the gods!"
"Then maybe Pharos, god of war and judgement saw fit to guide you here to satisfy your vengeance and save us in the same moment."
"That must have been some fight, <sir/madam>! I will have the masons come down and repair the cells right away."
"Should the enemy assault the gates again, we will doubtless take more prisoners and this time do a better job of holding them."
"Then we shall pay a tithe to Callahi, god of gold, tonight at the temple."
"You should speak to Dyschall, <sir/madam>. He knows the will of the gods better than we do."
"Who can know the will of the gods? Certainly not men such as us."
"We are doomed. I do not see how you could possibly clear all the forces of the Masked Man from the dungeon."
"I'm glad you came. Something has filled the prisoners we took following the battle with renewed purpose and they've broken free of their cells." Dylan offers you a weary grin.
"We have managed to hold this area, but we need more men if we are going to contain them and quell the threat."
"Sir Dylan! They tried attacking us again, but we held them off. There's no way we can stand another push."
"Calm yourself! This is no time to panic."
"You didn't see the huge hobgoblin that drives the prisoners before him! This, Sir, is the perfect time to panic!"
"Look, I need some volunteers to drive back the Masked Man's forces. If we attack them now, before they have time to regroup, we might stand a chance!"
"I didn't sign up for this suicide mission. You should let us get out of here! If we can get to our homes, perhaps we can flee with our families."
"Sir Dylan, I would... ah, the pain, I would help you, but the wound I received..."
"I wish the Hand could have taken some of the militia to the gate and given me some professional soldiers! Get back to your post!"
"<FirstName>, I hate to ask this of you, but do you think you can try to push the invaders back?"
"There are some weapons and armor over there on the racks. You might want to have a look and take what you need."
"Good luck, <sir/madam>! You're the only hope we have, though even that is a slim hope. At the least, perhaps you can buy us some time."

"There aren't any soldiers, sadly. If I had some properly trained warriors to assist me I might have been able to put an end to this prison break, or at least put a dent in their number before we withdrew."
"You might still be able to rescue some of the prisoners. They're criminals, but I suppose if you set them free, they might be willing to help you."
"We're not sure where the leader is hiding out; I never even saw him. He must be down in the dungeon somewhere."
"I need to remain here and keep these men from deserting. If the prisoners try to force their way back up here, someone needs to keep them from succeeding."
"I hope to serve you well, Lord of Cyan." Dylan bows low at your approach.
"The hobgoblin is dead."
"I sought revenge against these monsters, nothing more."
"I saw an opportunity and I came after it. Gold is my only god."
"Forget the gods, I came of my own free will to save you!"
"If the gods laid this path before me, I am proud to be chosen."
"I know nothing of these gods. I merely did my duty."
"I'll take care of it."
"Isn't there anyone else who can help me?"
"Where is this hobgoblin?"
"What are you going to do?"
